Welcome, thrice auspicious day!</br>Sweeter than the vernal May;</br>Smiling mirth without alloy;</br>Laughing wit and social ease,</br>And each happy child of peace.</br>Come, then Goddess, blyth and free,</br>Heaven-descended LIBERTY;</br>Come with all thy jocund train,</br>From the variegated plain;</br>From the flower-bespangled dale,</br>Where the Zephyrs fan the gale;</br>Where the shepherd tends his flock</br>Underneath the pendant rock;</br>From the meadow's fragrant pride,</br>Where the soothing streamlets glide;</br>From the woodland's shady grove,</br>And each rural haunt of love;</br>From the city's splendid courts,</br>And the scenes where fortune sports:</br>Come, to GEORGE your tribute pay</br>On this fame-distinguish'd day;</br>When first to grace the British throne</br>He rose with lustre all his own.</br>See the Goddess wings her flight</br>From the fields of endless light;</br>Fair her form, her manners sweet,</br>Nature smiles beneath her feet;</br>Her presence every object charms,</br>And every breast to rapture warms.</br>In gentle accents, and with brow serene,</br>She calls her children from each pleasing scene.
See, they come!  the frolic band,</br>Gayly frisking o'er the plain;</br>Soft they move with aspects bland,</br>And the MUSES lead the train.

Hark, hark, they touch the vocal strings;</br>With rapture's blaze the numbers rise;</br>And, borne on Aether's fleeting wrings,</br>To GEORGE the grateful strain they raise,</br>To GEORGE, who merits all their praise;</br>For him, their friend, their noblest wreathes they twine;</br>For him, their patron, swell the glowing line.

FANCY too appears attendant,</br>Keen her look, and bright her eye;</br>On her arm a robe dependent</br>Hangs, of Nature's various dye.</br>Welcome, sweet bewitching creature,</br>Firer of the Muse's song!</br>Most delightful child of Nature,</br>Charmer of the heavenly throng!

And see what fairy forms advance,</br>Joining in the sprightly dance,</br>Ever blythe and gay;</br>'Tis the Graces, Loves, and Pleasures,</br>Tripping light in wanton measures,</br>Pouring out their choicest treasures</br>On this happy day.

Fraught with the spoils of many  years,</br>Behold each sister ART appears,</br>Cloath'd with celestial flame;</br>Each SCIENCE rears her laurel'd head,</br>Distinguish'd by the noblest meed,</br>A Sov'reign's just acclaim.</br>Rich COMMERCE comes, the sire of wealth,</br>And INDUSTRY, the friend of health,</br>With native lustre crown'd,</br>With TRADE, who every land explores,</br>And pours profuse his boundless stores,</br>Where Liberty is found.</br>Fair JUSTICE, darting heavenly rays,</br>Her open generous front displays,</br>The guardian of the whole;</br>With ruthless Law, of brow severe,</br>And Pity, mild with beaming fear,</br>"That speaks the very soul."</br>The Virtues too adorn'd the scene,</br>Led on by Innocence their queen,</br>Who wears eternal smiles;</br>Whose peaceful breast still feels the fire</br>Of dauntless Truth, her blissful fire,</br>And mocks all human wiles.

Such was the train the Goddess led,</br>When to Britannia's plaints she sped,</br>Encircled with a blaze of day,</br>To Thames's banks she wing'd her way,</br>And, fir'd with rapture at each view,</br>To GEORGE'S arms extatic flew:</br>On him she bade her influence shine,</br>With all her radiant charms divine;</br>To him resign'd the cap and rod,</br>And bade the nations own his nod;</br>While he, with gen'rous heart, bestow'd</br>Her treasures for the public good,</br>Profusely spreading o'er the land</br>Her blessings with a liberal hand.</br>Such bounteous gifts great GEORGE alone bestows,</br>Such blissful days Britannia only knows.

Then let each British swain rejoice,</br>With acclamations swell your voice,</br>The grateful voice of praise;</br>Raise, raise aloud sweet music's sound,</br>Let hills and dales your joy resound,</br>And nature catch the blaze.</br>Dispel discord and factious strife,</br>And all that sours your bliss of life,</br>Join Concord's happy band;</br>Contract yourselves in Friendship's ties,</br>Let unanimity arise</br>Throughout the British land.

That peace shall every blessing bring,</br>"To Britain, and to Britain's king."</br>And when the firy God of war</br>Shall mount his blood besprinkl'd car,</br>Britain obedient, at his call,</br>Triumphant in the bloody field,</br>Still shall she wear the victor shield:</br>Her dauntless sons of death shall check the pride of SPAIN,</br>And prove her noblest claim the empire of the main.</br>
